abstracts.cdata!:
The project was the fifth in a series of
            related loans supported by the Bank in Brazil. The cost of
            the Federal Railway Export Corridor Project was estimated to
            be US$422.0 million, with a Bank Loan of US$200 million
            equivalent. Final project costs were US$373.4 million, with
            US$194.4 million disbursed from the Bank Loan. According to
            the Staff Appraisal Report (SAR) and the Loan Agreement
            (LA), project objectives were the financial rehabilitation
            and improved commercial performance of the Federal Railway
            System; and increased transport efficiency in the two export
            corridors of Parand and Goias- Minas Gerais. To support the
            project's objectives, loan proceeds were to finance:
            (i) a policy development and institutional component which,
            through the use of action plans, would address company-wide
            and sectoral issues; and (ii) an investment component which,
            through strategically located investments, would improve
            transport operations in the two export corridors.
